aboutOverview.title: About Us
aboutOverview.para1: The development of the dairy sector in the region was formally initiated in 1989 with the establishment of the Raichur & Bellary Co-operative Milk Producers’ Societies Union Ltd. during 1989–90. The Union was formed to strengthen organized milk production and marketing by bringing rural milk producers under a structured co-operative framework. From its inception, the Union aimed to create a sustainable system that would benefit farmers economically while ensuring a steady supply of quality milk to consumers.
aboutOverview.para2: The operational jurisdiction of the Union initially extended across the entire Raichur District, covering four talukas, and the Bellary District, comprising seven talukas. By organizing village-level milk producers into co-operative societies, the Union enabled farmers to collectively market their milk, access veterinary and technical services, and receive fair and timely payments. This approach significantly reduced exploitation by middlemen and improved income stability for rural households.
aboutOverview.para3: The Union adopted the AMUL co-operative model, which emphasizes farmer ownership, democratic management, and transparent operations. Dairying was promoted as a major subsidiary occupation, particularly for small and marginal farmers, with the objective of achieving socio-economic upliftment in rural areas. Through this model, the Union not only enhanced milk production and productivity but also contributed to employment generation and improved livelihoods.
aboutOverview.para4: Subsequently, the Union expanded its operational area by including Koppal District, leading to its reconstitution as the Raichur, Bellary & Koppal Co-operative Milk Producers’ Societies Union Ltd. This expansion strengthened the regional dairy network and reinforced the Union’s role in rural development, making dairying a reliable and sustainable source of income for farmers across the three districts.

productsPreview.dairyProductsSubtitle: A wide range of fresh and high-quality milk and milk products delivered with care and trust.

overview.title: Overview
overview.text: This Privacy Policy describes the information collected by us (RBKVMUL – Raichur, Ballari, Koppala & Vijayanagara Milk Union Ltd.) through our mobile applications and related services and how we use that information.

children.title: Information of Children
children.text: Our services do not address anyone under the age of 13 as our services are not relevant to children. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13.

personalInfo.title: Personal Information
personalInfo.text: For a better experience while using our Service, we may require you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information, including but not limited to location, name, address, mobile number, device model, and Android version.

location.title: Location
location.para1: This app collects location data to enable Check-in/Check-out functionality even when the app is closed or not in use. A notification is displayed to the user when location is being captured. Users are prompted before location capture starts.
location.para2: Once the user enables check-out, the location capture is stopped. We do not share the captured location with external sources.

advertising.title: Advertising
advertising.text: We do not allow third-party banner advertisements. We have no intention to introduce them, but if we ever do, this policy will be updated accordingly.

sharing.title: Sharing of Information
sharing.para1: We value your trust in providing your personal information and strive to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. We do not share personally identifiable information such as name, address, email, or phone number with other companies.
sharing.para2: However, please note that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.
sharing.para3: Payment gateways and payment processing services are compliant with industry standards (PCI compliant service providers). Users are advised not to share full credit or debit card details through unencrypted platforms.
sharing.para4: Where a Customer ID and password are used to access the platform, users are responsible for keeping these credentials confidential and should not share them with anyone.

support.title: When You Request Support, You May Send Us Email
support.text: Users may contact us with questions about the use of our mobile applications. If a support request is submitted, we may receive the user's email address and other information provided in relation to the request.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.text: If you have any questions or concerns regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

changes.title: Changes to this Privacy Policy
changes.text: This Privacy Policy may be updated from time to time. The use of information we collect is subject to the Privacy Policy in effect at the time such information is collected.

companyProfile.title: Company Profile
companyProfile.description: The development of the dairy sector was initiated in the year 1989. RBKVMUL (Raichur, Ballari, Koppala & Vijayanagara Milk Union Ltd.) was established during 1989–90, with its operational area extending across the entire Raichur District comprising four talukas and the Ballari District comprising seven talukas. The Union undertook the organization of milk co-operatives following the AMUL co-operative model, with the primary objective of achieving socio-economic upliftment of farmers in rural areas by promoting dairying as a major subsidiary occupation. Subsequently, the Union expanded its jurisdiction by including Koppala District, leading to its reconstitution as the Raichur, Ballari & Koppala Co-operative Milk Producers’ Societies Union Ltd.

mission.title: Our Mission
points: 1.To promote producer-oriented viable co-operative societies to impart impetus to rural income, dairy productivity, and rural employment.
2.To bridge the gap between the price of milk procurement and the sale price.
3.To develop business acumen in marketing and trading disciplines to serve consumers with quality milk and enhance the income of milk producers.
mission.note: Our Union is committed to the socio-economic development of its member milk producers by adopting advanced technology to make dairying a profitable business. Through dedicated workmanship, the Union aims to provide the best services to its members and consumers and achieve a leading position in Karnataka.

values.title: Our Values
list: Honesty
Discipline / Timeliness
Quality
Trust
Impartiality
Savings
Transparency

objectives.title: Objectives
objectives.description: Human Resource policies in the dairy industry cover core areas such as recruitment (skilled and unskilled), training (safety and technical), compensation, performance management, and statutory compliance. These policies place strong emphasis on workplace safety, prevention of harassment, leave management, and ethical conduct, along with specific regulations related to youth and child labour. Effective HR practices improve quality and productivity, reduce employee turnover, and enhance farm profitability by aligning people management with dairy operations and sustainability goals.

functions.title: Main Functions
list: Matching skills (technical for processing, physical for farm) with operational needs, forecasting labour demand.
Clear processes, sharing culture/values, providing job descriptions, assigning trainers, explaining worker's comp.
Mandatory safety training, accident/injury reporting, emergency plans, personal hygiene, drug/alcohol policies.
Professionalism, respect, anti-harassment, confidentiality, conflict of interest, attendance (punctuality, leave notification)
Fair pay, benefits to attract/retain talent, ensuring satisfaction.
Feedback, skill improvement, linking performance to quality/quantity goals.
Clear policies on holidays, sick leave, etc..
Strict rules on age (min 14), working hours (daytime, 4.5 hrs./day), and fitness certification.
Linking HR to environmental goals, promoting values-driven commitment.
Skilled, motivated staff directly improves milk quality and quantity.
Good HR reduces high turnover common in farm work.
Meets legal requirements, especially around safety and youth employment.
Better management leads to operational efficiency and financial success.
functions.summary: Start with essential policies for safety, conduct, and leave, use templates, and build up comprehensive systems as you grow, focusing on integrating HR with the unique demands of dairy farming.

key.title: Our Key Objectives
list: Profit maximization from the dairy sector.
Socio-economic stability of dairy farmers of the state.
Increase production of milk to ensure the availability of recommended minimum dietary requirement.
Compliance with Food Safety and Standards Act 2006.
To ensure fresh and safe milk to consumers of the state.
Increase Rural Employment Opportunities through Entrepreneurship.
Sustainable Development of the sector.
Strengthening of the organized Dairy farming sector through Co-operatives.
Value addition and improved marketing to provide fair price to the farmers.
Innovation, Research and Development for cost effective production.
Provide adequate and quality services at farmers’ door step.
Technology transfer through effective extension activities.
Automate the milk collection and pricing system of the Dairy Co-operatives.
Unify the accounting and management system of the Dairy Co-operatives.
Creating a network between the Dairy Co-operatives, the Dairy Development Department and   other stake holders for efficient and effective management.

quality.title: Quality & Food Safety
list: Healthy cows, clean housing, proper feeding, and responsible antimicrobial use are foundational.
Strict hand washing, clean attire (uniforms, hairnets, gloves), and reporting illnesses are crucial to prevent contamination.
Facilities must be cleanable, with proper drainage; equipment (milking machines, tanks) must be sanitized regularly.
Immediate cooling (to ≤8°C), testing for antibiotics/contaminants at pickup, and maintaining cold chain during transport.
Implementing HACCP, pasteurization, and GMP{/nav} (Good Manufacturing Practices) to control hazards like pathogens, allergens, and physical contaminants.
Regular lab checks for fat, protein, bacterial counts (coliforms), somatic cells, residues, and adulterants.
Maintaining detailed records for all stages to enable rapid recalls and accountability.
Commitment to producing safe, superior quality milk products.
Meeting or exceeding legal requirements and consumer expectations.
Continuous improvement in quality performance.
Open communication of the policy to all stakeholders.

ballari.title: Ballari: The Heartland of History & Wildlife

sites.name: Kanaka Durgamma Temple
sites.info:
The Kanaka Durgamma Temple is the spiritual heart of Ballari, dedicated to the city's presiding deity. Historically, the goddess is viewed as the celestial protector of the region, and the temple sits at a point that has seen the rise and fall of various local dynasties.

During the annual Jatra festival, the city transforms into a vibrant hub of devotion. Thousands of pilgrims participate in the chariot pulling, representing a deep-rooted cultural bond that transcends modern urban life and keeps ancient traditions alive.

sites.name: Daroji Sloth Bear Sanctuary
sites.info:
Established in 1994, this is Asia's first dedicated sanctuary for the Sloth Bear. The terrain is a rugged, boulder-strewn landscape of dry deciduous forests, providing a perfect natural fortress for bears that have inhabited these rocky hillocks for centuries.

Visitors can observe bears emerging from caves at dusk from a safe watchtower. The sanctuary is also a biodiversity hotspot, home to leopards, hyenas, and over 200 bird species, making it a premier eco-tourism destination in North Karnataka.

sites.name: Kumaraswamy Temple, Sandur
sites.info:
Located in the lush green mountains of Sandur, this 8th-11th century temple complex is a rare architectural gem from the Chalukya and Rashtrakuta eras. The temple is famous for being the first to be dedicated to Lord Kartikeya in South India.

Sandur was famously described by Mahatma Gandhi as 'See Sandur in September' due to its breathtaking monsoon beauty. The temple offers a serene spiritual retreat, surrounded by iron-ore rich hills that create a unique red-and-green landscape unlike anywhere else.

koppal.title: Koppal: The Kashi of the South

sites.name: Gavi Siddeshwara Matha
sites.info:
An ancient cave monastery that stands as a powerhouse of social service and the Lingayat tradition. It is globally recognized for its 'Trividha Dasoha'—the selfless provision of free food, education, and spiritual shelter to all seekers regardless of caste.

The annual Koppal Jatra held here is the largest in the region, often called the 'Fair of the South.' It is a massive display of community spirit where millions gather to celebrate the philosophy of 'Work is Worship' and witness the grand chariot procession.

sites.name: Mahadeva Temple, Itagi
sites.info:
Built in 1112 AD by the Western Chalukyas, this temple is hailed in historical inscriptions as the 'Devalaya Chakravarti' (Emperor among Temples). Its soapstone carvings and intricate pillar designs are considered the pinnacle of medieval craftsmanship.

The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and features a large closed hall with 68 pillars. Its architectural finesse rivals that of Belur and Halebidu, making it a mandatory stop for students of Indian art history and architecture.

sites.name: Kuknur Navalinga Temple
sites.info:
This 9th-century complex consists of nine shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva, representing the early evolution of Dravidian architecture. The temples were built by the Rashtrakutas and are known for their distinct clusters and ancient scripts carved into the stone.

Kuknur is a significant center for pilgrims and historians alike. The site provides a quiet, meditative atmosphere where one can appreciate the transition of temple building styles from the early medieval period to the later Chalukyan glory.

raichur.title: Raichur: The Land of Forts and Gold

sites.name: Hatti Gold Mines
sites.info:
Hatti is one of the oldest gold mines in the world, with a history of extraction dating back to the Ashokan period. It remains the only functional gold-producing mine in India today, blending ancient mining heritage with modern industrial technology.

The site is a symbol of Raichur's strategic economic importance through the ages. It offers a fascinating look at how natural mineral wealth has shaped the migration, economy, and geopolitical struggles of the Krishna-Tungabhadra Doab.

sites.name: Raichur Fort
sites.info:
Built in 1294 AD, the Raichur Fort is famous for its massive stone masonry and 12-meter high walls constructed without the use of mortar. It contains inscriptions in Sanskrit, Telugu, and Arabic, reflecting the diverse cultures that ruled here.

The fort has been a bone of contention between the Vijayanagara Empire and the Bahmani Sultanate. Today, it stands as a testament to medieval military engineering, featuring the iconic 'Navrang' wall and a massive stone lift used to move heavy blocks.

sites.name: Maski Ashokan Edict
sites.info:
Maski is a world-renowned archaeological site where a minor rock edict of Emperor Ashoka was discovered in 1915. It was the first edict to explicitly mention the name 'Ashoka' instead of the usual title 'Devanampriya.'

This discovery was a turning point in Indian historiography, confirming the identity of the great Mauryan emperor. The site is a pilgrimage for history buffs, proving Raichur’s ancient connection to one of the greatest empires in human history.

sites.name: Hampi UNESCO World Heritage Site
sites.info:
Hampi is the sprawling ruin of the 14th-century Vijayanagara Empire capital. It is an open-air museum featuring over 1,600 surviving monuments, including the active Virupaksha Temple, royal palaces, and aquatic structures.

As a UNESCO site, it attracts global travelers who come to see the musical pillars and the Stone Chariot. It represents the height of South Indian Hindu culture, art, and administrative brilliance before the city was destroyed in 1565.

sites.name: Tungabhadra (TB) Dam
sites.info:
A marvel of modern Indian engineering, this multipurpose dam was constructed across the Tungabhadra River. It provides vital irrigation and power to three states and is a symbol of post-independence progress in the region.

The dam area features a beautiful Japanese garden, musical fountains, and a deer park. During the monsoon, when the gates are opened, the roaring waters create a spectacular sight that draws thousands of tourists for weekend getaways.

sites.name: Mylara Lingeshwara Temple
sites.info:
Located in Hoovina Hadagali, this temple is dedicated to Lord Mylara, an incarnation of Shiva. It is famous for the unique 'Goravara Kunitha' folk dance and the 'Karnika' (prophecy) delivered during the annual fair.

The temple acts as a cultural anchor for the farming community, where ancient folk traditions are preserved by the 'Goravas'—devotees dressed in black woolen blankets and bear-skin headgear, performing ancient rhythmic rituals.

activities.title: Activities
activities.procurementIntro: The procurement process involves collecting milk from producers, ensuring quality through rigorous testing (fat, SNF, adulteration), chilling it quickly for freshness, and transporting it to the plant, often via village collection centers and chilling centers for eventual processing, with payment to farmers based on quality, emphasizing transparency and farmer support through cooperative models or direct systems to maintain a consistent, high-quality supply.
activities.breakdown: Here's a breakdown of the key stages:

sourcing.title: Sourcing & Collection
points: Milk is delivered from farmers (often twice daily) to local centers, often managed by cooperatives or the dairy itself.
Dairies either establish their own centers (direct) or use agents/contractors to collect milk from producers.
Dairies often train farmers in hygienic milking and handling to ensure clean milk.

testing.title: Quality Testing & Chilling
points: At the VLC, milk is weighed and tested for fat, Solids-Not-Fat (SNF), and adulteration (e.g., water).
Milk is quickly cooled (e.g., to 4°C) in bulk coolers at the VLC or a chilling center to preserve quality and prevent bacterial growth.
Samples are taken for more detailed lab analysis before dispatch.

transport.title: Transportation & Processing
transport.p1: Chilled milk is transported in insulated tankers to the main dairy plant, often via a chilling center for consolidation.
transport.p2: Upon arrival at the dairy, milk undergoes further rigorous quality checks before processing (pasteurization, separation, etc.).

payment.title: Payment & Management
points: Farmers are paid based on the quantity and quality (fat/SNF content) of milk supplied, with payments often made periodically (e.g., every 10 days).
Payment slips detail the quality parameters and amount due, with funds often transferred to bank accounts.

goals.title: Key Goals
points: Maintaining high standards from farm to plant.
Creating strong cold chains and organized collection routes.
goals.summary: This system relies heavily on technology (like automated testing units) and strong farmer relationships to build a reliable, high-quality supply chain.

animalHealth.title: Animal Health Services
animalHealth.intro: The animal health process is a proactive, integrated system focusing on prevention (biosecurity, vaccination, good nutrition/housing, staff training), early detection (monitoring behaviour, temperature, milk quality), and swift, targeted treatment (veterinary protocols, isolation of sick animals, observing withdrawal times), all managed through detailed records to ensure welfare, reduce costs (like mastitis treatment), and maintain high-quality milk production, often using technology for continuous monitoring.
animalHealth.coreTitle: Here's a breakdown of the core components:
animalHealth.coreP1: The system focuses on prevention through biosecurity, vaccination, nutrition, housing, and staff training.
animalHealth.corep2: Early detection and prompt treatment help protect animal health and milk safety.
bioPoints: Limiting new animal introductions and screening them thoroughly to prevent disease entry.
Using vaccines and treatments strategically to build immunity.
Maintaining clean housing, milking equipment, and water supplies to reduce pathogen loads.
Providing balanced feed and suitable housing to minimize stress and disease risk.

ai.title: Artificial Insemination Emergency activites
ai.intro: The artificial insemination (AI) process in dairy involves collecting bull semen, processing/freezing it in straws, and then a skilled technician manually depositing it into a cow's uterus using an "AI gun" and rectal palpation to pinpoint the cervix at the right time (heat/estrus) for fertilization, improving genetics and production without natural mating. Key steps include detecting heat, preparing the semen (thawing a frozen straw), inserting a lubricated arm into the rectum to guide the gun, passing the gun through the cervix, and depositing semen in the uterine body for conception.
semenPoints: Semen is collected from genetically superior bulls.
Mixed with extenders (milk, sugars, antibiotics) for nutrition and protection, then diluted.
Placed in small plastic straws, frozen in liquid nitrogen at -196°C, and stored.

fodder.title: Fodder Activity
fodder.intro: Fodder production in the dairy industry involves planning, cultivating specific crops (like maize, sorghum, legumes), or using modern techniques like hydroponics/sprouting for year-round green fodder, conserving surplus as silage/hay, processing crop residues into fortified blocks, and ensuring consistent quality for optimal animal nutrition, which all boost milk yield and farm sustainability. The process balances field growing, conservation (hay/silage), and innovative indoor methods to meet dairy herd nutritional needs.
traditionalPoints: Assess herd needs, available land, water, and climate to select suitable fodder crops (e.g., maize, sorghum, oats, like Desmanthus).
Prepare land, sow seeds (often with fertilizers), irrigate (or rely on rain), and manage pests.
Cut crops at optimal growth stages (e.g., maize at milk-dough stage) for maximum nutrients, using mowers and binders.
conservationPoints: Ferment chopped green fodder (maize, sorghum) in airtight silos to preserve nutrients.
Dry cut fodder (grasses, legumes) in the sun, then bale it for storage.

step.title: Support to Training and Employment Programme for Women (STEP)
step.stepDesc: Women in the dairy industry are supported through various government and organizational programs, including the Support to Training and Employment Programme for Women (STEP), the National Programme for Dairy Development (NPDD), and schemes promoted by NABARD through women's Self Help Groups (SHGs).
stepPoints: Support to Training and Employment Programme for Women (STEP): Funded by the Ministry of Women & Child Development, this program provides financial and technical assistance to implement agencies (like dairy cooperatives and NGOs) to organize women into dairy cooperative societies (WDCS). Training and employment opportunities are provided, including access to credit for purchasing livestock.

National Programme for Dairy Development (NPDD): Implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry and Dairying, this scheme provides financial assistance for training dairy farmers (including women) and staff of dairy cooperative societies on clean milk production, animal health, nutrition, and good management practices.

NABARD Initiatives: The National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) supports skill and entrepreneurship training for women through Micro Enterprise Development Programmes (MEDPs) and Livelihood and Enterprise Development Programmes (LEDPs), often delivered through SHGs. NABARD also provides concessional refinance to banks for loans given to women's SHGs.
step.processingDesc: Dairy processing turns raw milk into safe, consumable products through steps like collection, testing, filtration, pasteurization (heating to kill germs), homogenization (breaking fat for smoothness), standardization (adjusting fat), and product-specific steps (fermentation for yogurt, churning for butter), followed by packaging and distribution to ensure quality and shelf-life.
coreSteps: Milk arrives from farms, is tested for quality, safety, and composition (fat/protein), then cooled and stored.
Centrifugal force separates milk into cream (high fat) and skim milk (low fat).
Fat content is adjusted by blending cream and skim milk for consistent product quality (e.g., whole, low-fat milk).
Heating milk to specific temperatures to destroy pathogens and extend shelf life.
Breaks down fat globules under high pressure to prevent cream from rising, ensuring a uniform texture.
productSteps: Involves adding bacterial cultures for fermentation and coagulation.
Cream is churned to separate butterfat from buttermilk.
Milk is concentrated in evaporators and spray-dried.
Milk and products are filled into hygienic containers (cartons, bottles) to protect them from light, air, and recontamination.
Chilled storage and refrigerated transport ensure freshness until it reaches consumers.

popup.title: Announcement
popup.subtitle: Mega Dairy Outline
popup.description: Upcoming Mega Dairy at Bellary Taluka Kolagal Grama. Approved by Karnataka Mining Environment Restoration Corporation (KMERC).

cancellation_returns.title: Cancellation & Returns
cancellation_returns.paragraph1: We, at RBKVMUL, are committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction. Due to our strict quality standards, products once opened cannot be repackaged or resold. Therefore, we do not accept returns on opened merchandise.
cancellation_returns.paragraph2: In unusual circumstances, if a product is damaged during delivery, we offer a replacement. Any product damage must be reported to the respective marketing representative within 24 hours of delivery. The product must be self‑shipped to our address for verification.
cancellation_returns.paragraph3: Upon receipt of the product, quality checks will be performed and a replacement or refund claim will be issued as per the requirement. Refund claims will be adjusted in the invoice.
cancellation_returns.paragraph4: Please note that exchanges or refunds are not offered on opened or used products. RBKVMUL is not responsible for damages occurring after delivery.

processing_time.title: Processing Time
processing_time.paragraph1: Please allow one to three working days from the date of return for your request to be processed. You will be contacted once the return process is complete.
processing_time.paragraph2: All claims for damages or missing items must be reported within 24 hours of delivery. Requests made after 24 hours will not be processed.

exclusions.title: Exclusions
exclusions.paragraph1: Damages caused due to negligence or incorrect application are not covered under the Returns Policy.
exclusions.paragraph2: No exchange or return will be processed in cases where there are no quality‑related issues.
exclusions.paragraph3: Consumers are advised to ensure lactose tolerance before consuming the products.

cancellation_policy.title: Cancellation Policy
cancellation_policy.paragraph1: Orders placed through https://www.rbkvmul.in can be cancelled before dispatch. Once the order has been dispatched or delivered, it cannot be cancelled and no refunds will be issued.

out_of_stock.title: Out of Stock Items
out_of_stock.paragraph1: In case of out‑of‑stock items, customers may add products to their wishlist. Once the products are back in stock, an automated notification will be sent, allowing the order to be placed easily.

payments.title: Payments
payments.paragraph1: RBKVMUL offers the following payment options:

list.net_banking: Net Banking (all major banks in India)

payments.paragraph2: All online payments are processed through trusted payment gateways using encryption technology to ensure secure transactions. Payments made via card or net banking are safe and secure.

In addition, when you use any RBKVMUL service (e.g. sharing Product listing, Checking Price, Product availability), you will be subject to the policies, guidelines, terms, and conditions applicable to such services, as incorporated in this Agreement. RBKVMUL reserves the right to change this site and these terms and conditions mentioned herein at any time. RBKVMUL reserves the right to deny access to the Site to anyone who we believe has violated any of these Terms of Use. If you are under 18, you may use RBKVMUL only with supervision/participation/involvement of a parent or guardian. USING THE SITE (WHICH INCLUDES ACCESSING AND BROWSING) INDICATES YOUR AGREEMENT TO ALL THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS IN THIS AGREEMENT, SO PLEASE READ THIS AGREEMENT CAREFULLY BEFORE PROCEEDING.

contents_posted.title: Contents Posted on Site
contents_posted.paragraph: You are responsible for all text, e‑mails, posts, photos, profile information, opinion, graphic, images, videos, audio, or files and materials or information that you post on or submit or transmit to the Sites (referred to as "Content"). Such Content will become the property of RBKVMUL throughout the universe. RBKVMUL shall be entitled to, consistent with our Privacy Policy, use the Content or any of its elements for any type of use forever, including but not limited to promotional and advertising purposes and in any media whether now known or hereafter devised, including the creation of derivative works that may include Content you provide. You agree that any Content you post may be used by RBKVMUL, consistent with our Privacy Policy and Rules of Conduct on Site as mentioned herein, and you are not entitled to any payment or other compensations for such use.

conduct.title: Conduct on Site
conduct.paragraph1: You may not post, distribute, or reproduce in any way any copyrighted material, trademarks, or any other proprietary information without obtaining the prior written consent of the owner of such proprietary rights.
conduct.paragraph2: RBKVMUL may review, edit, reject, refuse to post and/or delete any content that in the sole judgment of RBKVMUL violate these Terms of Use or which might be offensive, illegal, or that might violate the rights, harm, or threaten the safety of another person.
conduct.paragraph3: Any information provided by you on this site will not be misleading in any way. You may not post or submit or transmit Content, (even if made in a joking, sarcastic or unintended manner), if it in any way: is patently offensive to the online community, such as sexually explicit content, or content that promotes obscenity, paedophilia, racism, bigotry, hatred or physical harm of any kind against any group or individual; harasses or advocates harassment of another person; involves the transmission of "junk mail," "chain letters," or unsolicited mass mailing or "spamming"; promotes illegal activities or conduct that is abusive, threatening, obscene, defamatory or libellous.
conduct.paragraph4: You may not infringe upon or violate any third party's rights [(including, but not limited to, intellectual property rights, rights of privacy (including without limitation unauthorized disclosure of a person's name, email address, physical address or phone number) or rights of publicity]; promote an illegal or unauthorized copy of another person's copyrighted work, such as providing pirated computer programs or links to them, providing information to circumvent manufacture‑installed copy‑protect devices, or providing pirated music or links to pirated music files.
conduct.paragraph5: You must use the Site in a manner consistent with any and all applicable laws and regulations. Illegal and/or unauthorized uses of the Site, including without limitation, collecting usernames and/or email addresses of registered members by electronic or other means for the purpose of sending unsolicited email and unauthorized framing of or linking to the Sites, are not permitted.
conduct.paragraph6: You may not engage in advertising to, or solicitation of, other users through the Sites to buy or sell any products or services, including, but not limited to, products or services related to the Sites.
conduct.paragraph7: RBKVMUL reserves the right, but has no obligation, to monitor the materials posted in the public areas of the Sites. RBKVMUL shall have the right to remove or edit any Content that in its sole discretion violates, or is alleged to violate, any applicable law or either the spirit or letter of these Terms of Use. Notwithstanding this right of RBKVMUL, YOU REMAIN SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE CONTENT OF THE MATERIALS YOU POST IN THE PUBLIC AREAS OF THE SITES AND IN YOUR PRIVATE MESSAGES.
conduct.paragraph8: RBKVMUL shall have all the rights to take necessary action and claim damages that may occur due to your involvement/participation in any way on your own or through group/s of People, intentionally or unintentionally in DoS/DDoS (Distributed Denial of Services).
conduct.paragraph9: Affiliates, other businesses RBKVMUL does not take responsibility or liability or warrant including but not limited to, the actions, products, content and services on RBKVMUL‘s website, which are linked through including but not limited to Affiliates and sites that use RBKVMUL‘s APIs or other integration tools.

links.title: Links
links.paragraph: This site may contain links to other web sites or you may be linked through other websites ("Linked Sites"). The Linked Sites are for your convenience only and you access them at your own risk. We are not responsible for the content of the Linked Sites, whether or not RBKVMUL is affiliated with sponsors of the sites. We do not in any way endorse the Linked Sites. We welcome links to this site. You may establish a hypertext link to this site, provided that the link does not state or imply any sponsorship or endorsement of your site by RBKVMUL. You must not use on your site or in any other manner any trademarks, service marks or any other materials appearing on the RBKVMUL site, including any logos or characters, without the express written consent of the owner of the mark or materials. You must not frame or otherwise incorporate into another web site or present in conjunction with or juxtaposed against such a web site any of the content or other materials on the RBKVMUL site without our prior written consent.

your_account.title: Your Account
your_account.paragraph: You agree that any use on the site is at your own risk and RBKVMUL is not responsible for it. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and password and for restricting access to your computer, and you agree to accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account or password. Products sold on/by RBKVMUL are not for people who are lactose intolerance.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.paragraph: Use of the Site is governed by our Privacy Policy, which can be located at Privacy Policy.

mandatory_declaration.title: Mandatory Declaration
mandatory_declaration.paragraph: You hereby declare that you have provided all necessary Legal Details for the shipment of the product to the destination specified by you in the Order. You further declare that the Product will be acquired for personal use of the Consignee and/or Buyer. The Product will not be sold, resold, bartered or in any way disposed for profit.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer of Warranties and Liability
disclaimer.paragraph1: This website, all the milk and products (including but not limited to software) and services, included on or otherwise made available to you through this site are provided by RBKVMUL “as is” and “as available” basis without any representation or warranties, express or implied except otherwise specified in writing. Without prejudice to the forgoing paragraph, RBKVMUL does not warrant that: This website will be constantly available, or available at all; or the information on this website is complete, true, accurate or non‑misleading.
disclaimer.paragraph2: RBKVMUL will not be liable to you in any way or in relation to the contents of, or use of, or otherwise in connection with, this website. RBKVMUL does not warrant that this site; information, content, materials, product (including software) or services included on or otherwise made available to you through this site; their servers; or electronic communication sent from RBKVMUL are free of viruses or other harmful components. Nothing on this website constitutes, or is meant to constitute, advice of any kind.
disclaimer.paragraph3: Certain state laws do not allow limitations on implied warranties or the exclusion or limitation of certain damages. If these laws apply to you, some or all of the above disclaimers, exclusions, or limitations may not apply to you, and you might have additional rights.

applicable_laws.title: Applicable Laws of the Land
applicable_laws.paragraph: This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted and construed in accordance with the laws of India. The place of jurisdiction shall be in Bangalore.

sale_in_india.title: Sale in India Only
sale_in_india.paragraph: Unless otherwise specified, the material on RBKVMUL is presented solely for the purpose of sale in India. RBKVMUL makes no representation that materials in RBKVMUL are appropriate or available for use in other locations/Countries other than India. Those who choose to access this site from other locations/Countries other than India do so on their own initiative and RBKVMUL is not responsible for supply of goods/refund for the goods ordered from other locations/Countries other than India, compliance with local laws, if and to the extent local laws are applicable.

trademark_copyright.title: Trademark, Copyright and Restriction
trademark_copyright.paragraph: This site is controlled and operated by RBKVMUL. All material on this site, including images, illustrations, audio clips, and video clips, are protected by copyrights, trademarks, and other intellectual property rights that are owned and controlled by us or by other parties that have licensed their material to us. Material on RBKVMUL web site owned, operated, licensed or controlled by us is solely for your personal, non‑commercial use. You must not copy, reproduce, republish, upload, post, transmit or distribute such material in any way, including by e‑mail or other electronic means and whether directly or indirectly and you must not assist any other person to do so. Without the prior written consent of the owner, modification of the materials, use of the materials on any other web site or networked computer environment or use of the materials for any purpose other than personal, non‑commercial use is a violation of the copyrights, trademarks and other proprietary rights, and is prohibited. Any use for which you receive any remuneration, whether in money or otherwise, is a commercial use for the purposes of this clause.

risk_of_loss.title: Risk of loss
risk_of_loss.paragraph: All items purchased from RBKVMUL are made pursuant to a shipment contract. This means that the risk of loss and title for such items pass to you upon our delivery to the carrier.

product_description.title: Product Description
product_description.paragraph: RBKVMUL tries to be as accurate as possible. However, RBKVMUL does not warrant that the product description or other content of this site is accurate, complete, reliable, current, or error‑free. If a product offered by RBKVMUL itself is not as described, your sole remedy is to return it in unused condition.

cancellation_of_order.title: Cancellation of order
cancellation_of_order.paragraph: RBKVMUL reserves the right to cancel any order without any explanation for doing so, under situation where RBKVMUL is not able to meet the requirement of the order placed or order so placed/cancelled does not comply with the RBKVMUL policy or for any other reason. However, RBKVMUL will ensure that any communication of cancellation of an order, so cancelled, is intimated within appropriate time to the concerned person and any applicable refund will be made in reasonable time.
